RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 80. Waiver Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $4,200 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 19 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 6 Allowe d 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOOD BYE PUTIN away well and raced up three wide entering the backstretch to track the early pacesetter, commenced his bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to get up in the final strides. FINDING WAYS away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, opened a clear advantage entering the final turn, and just failed to last while proving clearly second best. WISE MARKET broke sharply and tracked the leader one out from the rail entering the backstretch, loomed a danger from between rivals approaching the final turn, was unable to keep tabs with the pacesetter through the turn, and lacked the needed closing response when called upon. GORKY PARK dropped back to trail a compact field while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, continued to bide his time at the back of the pack while racing three wide entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing three out from the rail in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Finding Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Good Bye Putin
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 w, rallied 3 w, closed 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; , 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAKKEN OVERDRIVE away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside, opened a clear advantage approaching the final turn, and continued to widen his advantage over the final furlong while being ridden out late. BAK TO LIBERTY away alertly and tracked the pacesetter while racing three wide entering the backstretch, took up the chase while commencing his bid two wide entering the final turn, and held on for the place in deep stretch while finished one out from the rail. MAGIC ROAD settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, began to advance three wide midway to the final turn, continued two out from the rail through the turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to just miss the place. TAPITS CHOICE broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, continued to save ground through the final turn, and finished from along the inside in the drive. UNION MAN unhurried early while dropping back to trail, began to show interest approaching the final turn while mounting a three wide bid, and finished with some late interest two wide in the drive. BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing between rivals, struggled to maintain his position in the run to the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Tapits Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bakken Overdrive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Brian's de Leight
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 3w, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 82. Waiver Claiming Purse 13000. (PLUS UP TO $4,350 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British C olumbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHOTGUN RIDER broke sharply and tracked the dueling leaders through the first turn while racing one out from the rail, drove up along the inside to challenge for the lead midway down the backstretch when VALUABLE COWBOY bore out, battled from along the rail for the lead entering the final turn, took command entering the lane, and was never seriously threatened late. TIZ VICIOUS away well and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backside, advanced three wide midway down the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two out from the rail in the drive to grab the place. DRILLER broke in a bit of a tangle, but raced into a stalking trip from just off the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed with interest from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. VALUABLE COWBOY away alertly and battled for the lead from the inside of BABY GRAND entering the first turn while racing one out from the rail, drifted out into the middle of the track entering the backside while carrying his pace rival out with him, dropped back into the two path to battle for the lead entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages. BABY GRAND was fractious prior to the start, and hopped at the break, but rushed up to battled for the lead three wide entering the first turn, was carried extremely wide when his pace rival bore out entering the backstretch, dropped back to trail entering the final turn, and wasn't persevered with over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Valuable Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, bore out 7/16, rallied 2w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in tangle, stalked, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, hopped start, dueled 3w, carried out 7/16

ENTRY.NAME: Shotgun Rider
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Vicious
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, closed 2 wid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 66. Waiver Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JERSEY LILLIE away alertly and tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside while saving ground along the inside, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, tipped five wide entering the lane, and closed with a rush to get up in time. LASTING LIGHT broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of KANDY KATIE entering the first turn, continued to force the pace two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, and just failed to last. KANDY KATIE away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the inside of LASTING LIGHT in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and gave way grudgingly late in a solid effort. HARLAN'S ANGEL settled towards the back of the field while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly four wide in the drive but needed more. BAKFIRE BABY settled off the contested early pace while saving ground along the inside through the first turn and into the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a serious late impact while finishing three wide in the drive. BAKZONE tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, struggled to maintain her position in the run to the final turn, and faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Kandy Katie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Lillie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked inside, rallied 2w, closed 5w, up in time

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Ed Wright Cattle Co. Inc. & MilesChilders

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, faded 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 66. Waiver Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4 ,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WALKINTHEWALK settled well off the contested early pace while being carried three wide into the backstretch, dropped to the rail midway down the backside to save ground in the run to the final turn, rallied smartly from along the inside through the turn, shifted three wide entering the lane, and closed with a rush to get up in time. LIZZIES GIRL away well and dueled for the lead from between rivals entering the first turn, continued to force the issue from between rivals in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and finished determinedly from along the inside in the drive in a solid effort. ANAAMY tracked the contested early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, collared the pacesetters three wide entering the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane, and finished two wide in the drive to just miss the place. TEXAS HUMOR settled off the dueling leaders while racing three wide entering the backside, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive. ROSE OF TEXAS was slow into stride while racing a bit rank into the first turn, drifted four wide entering the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. VALERIE VALESKI away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, steadied sharply when in tight quarters at the rail entering the lane, and weakened late. SKY FACTOR broke sharply and pressed the pace three wide entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue three wide in the run to the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on the leaders entering the turn, and weakened over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there were two jockey claims of foul. The rider of VALERIE VALESKI lodged a claim of foul against the rider's of both LIZZIE'S GIRL and ANAAMY for alleged interference entering the lane. After review both claims of foul were dismissed and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Valerie Valeski
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, steadied 1/8, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Sky Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 3 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow into stride, settled 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Walkinthewalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied rail, closed 3 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.OWNER: Goss Maureen Canmor Farms and Trombley Adrian
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 97. Claiming Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 6 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 6 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIR BREGOVIC away alertly and raced to the lead from just off the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, drifted four wide entering the lane while being overtaken for the lead, but battled back gamely in deep stretch to get up in time. MAJESTIC STREET broke sharply and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, continued to chase the pacesetter two wide into the final turn, was carried five wide into the lane, but battled determinedly through the stretch to just miss. QUINTO SOL away well and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside through the final turn, slipped through at the rail to take command entering the lane, but was outfinished in deep stretch in a solid effort. FOREIGN PROTOCOL was pinched soon after the start and trailed the field into the first turn, raced with a wide trip in the run down the backside, rallied six wide through the final turn, and continued seven wide in the drive. PAY MY WAY settled off the early pace while racing four wide into the backstretch, commenced his bid one out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response late when called upon. FAMILY BIZ stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, continued to save ground through the final turn, and finished at the rail in the drive while unable to make a serious impact. STAY FANTASTIC stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but faded in the late going.

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Bregovic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied 2w, closed 3w, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Quinto Sol
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked inside, rallied rail, led, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign Protocol
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched start, trailed, rallied 6 wide, closed 7 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed 4w, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Pay My Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 75. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUNNY away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of LICORICE in the run down the backside, held a narrow advantage through the final turn, and pulled clear late under steady urging to prove best. LICORICE raced up two wide entering the first turn to battle for the lead, forced the issue from the outside of BUNNY in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival late, but battled on gamely three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. FREESTYLE was off a step slow, and allowed to settle off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backstretch, began to advance from along the inside midway down the backside, rallied two wide from between rivals through the final turn, and finished well three out from the rail in the drive to prove best of the rest. INDYETTA broke sharply and stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside through the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive. ARUNDEL CASTLE settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive in an even effort. ELLAMEISTER settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and found her best stride late while finishing at the rail. B C CHU CHU away alertly and tracked the leaders in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. HIGHER IMAGE settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, saved ground at the rail through the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. C C SUNRISE rushed up from the outside to chase the leaders to the first turn, but bore out badly entering the turn, raced wide throughout, and wasn't persevered with in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: B C Chu Chu
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Freestyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, settled rail, advanced 3/8, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Indyetta
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ellameister
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Higher Image
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Bunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, led, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: C C Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out 5/8, wide trip, no factor
